title: Richard Epstein on Property Rights, Zoning and Kelo
description: Richard Epstein, of the University of Chicago and Stanford's Hoover Institution, makes the case that many current zoning restrictions are essentially "takings" and property owners should receive compensation for the lost value of their land. He also discusses the Kelo case and the political economy of the regulation of land.
author: webmaster@econlib.org (Library of Economics and Liberty)
